attributes.action: Do not use externally set assessments to judge GCSE and A-Level grades
attributes.additional_details: Students have faced varying levels of disruption, affecting the length at which they have learnt the curriculum. Factors other than time away from school, such as family bereavement, a lack of internet access, parental job stresses, and mental health pressures, have further compounded the attainment gap. Teachers - the people who have spent years marking student's homework and past assessments - are undoubtedly best placed to know what they would be capable of.
attributes.background: Gavin Williamson has written to Ofqual, proposing 'externally set papers.' These are the opposite of what was originally promised - exams. We instead need more understanding and recognition that teachers can best access and grade students.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Cancel GCSE and A-levels in 2021 replace with Course Work and Teacher Assessment: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/564696

Base 2021 GCSE and A-Level Grades on Teacher Considerations and Mock Grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553307

Give students the option to take exams or receive assessed grades for 2020/21: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/559964

The Department for Education and Ofqual are consulting on the approach to awarding GCSE, AS and A level grades in 2021 following the cancellation of exams. You can find out more about this consultation here: https://www.gov.uk/government/consultations/consultation-on-how-gcse-as-and-a-level-grades-should-be-awarded-in-summer-2021
